prompt:
Create 4 prompts for a cohesive, chronologically flowing thank-you greeting card that tells a visual story (9:16 ratio):

üé® CREATIVITY MANDATE: Be genuinely creative, unique, and innovative! Avoid generic or clich√© designs. Think outside the box, surprise with unexpected elements, use bold artistic choices, and create something truly memorable and special. Push creative boundaries while staying appropriate for the card type and tone.

Theme: "Thank you for attending, thank you for helping prosper thought. include a nice quote in left interior. front Cover:  include John Gilbert clearly and mention ‚ÄúAI For Good Conference Stanford CA June 2025‚Äù. make the artwork in general beautiful, charming, but also appropriately professional. Include a nice tree in front cover on stanford campus and include cute cartoon green dinosaur holding a greeting card with a heart. don‚Äôt draw any people. use light color theme. make sure any text is not close to borders"
Style: ‚ú® Smart Style
Tone: üåü Inspirational - motivating and uplifting
To: John Gilbert
From: Vibecarding.com Team
Message: "John,

Thank you for being a part of AI for Good this year. Your presence and insightful contributions truly helped to elevate the conversation and inspire new ways of thinking. We are so grateful for minds like yours that are actively shaping a brighter, more thoughtful future for everyone.

With sincere appreciation,
The Vibecarding.com Team"



CRITICAL: Create a cohesive visual narrative that flows chronologically through the card experience:
1. FRONT COVER: First impression - sets the scene/introduces the story
2. INTERIOR SPREAD: The heart of the experience - continuation and climax of the visual story
3. BACK COVER: Conclusion - peaceful resolution or complementary ending

Requirements:
- Flat 2D artwork for printing (not 3D card images)
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- IMPORTANT: Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges (small amount may be cropped in printing)
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
- CONSISTENT visual elements throughout: same characters, color palette, lighting, art style
- Progressive visual storytelling from front ‚Üí interior ‚Üí back
- Put any text in quotes and make it clear/readable
- Each section should feel like part of the same artistic universe
- TONE: Ensure the visual mood and atmosphere matches the motivating and uplifting tone throughout all sections
- INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY SAFETY: If the user mentions specific characters, brands, logos, or products, automatically replace them with original generic alternatives in your prompts. For example: replace specific character names with "cartoon mouse character" or "superhero character", replace brand names with "colorful cereal" or "sports car", etc. Create inspired-by designs that capture the essence without referencing any protected names or specific copyrighted elements. Never include actual brand names, character names, or trademarked terms in the image generation prompts
- CONTENT SAFETY: Ensure all prompts are family-friendly and appropriate for greeting cards. Avoid any content that could be flagged by safety systems including: violence, weapons, inappropriate imagery, political content, controversial topics, scary or disturbing elements, or anything not suitable for all ages. If the user requests something potentially inappropriate, redirect to positive, wholesome alternatives that capture their intent in a family-friendly way








Create prompts that flow chronologically:

1. Front Cover (Opening Scene): BE GENUINELY CREATIVE AND UNIQUE! Include "thank-you" greeting text positioned safely in the center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image). TEXT STYLE: Write the greeting text in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that matches the elegant style used inside the card - legible, flowing, and graceful with natural character and warmth. Create charming cartoon-style or stylized illustrated figures if people are needed for the theme. This is the story opening - introduce key visual elements (colors, motifs, artistic style) that will continue throughout the other sections. Think of something unexpected, innovative, and memorable that will surprise and delight the recipient. Avoid generic designs! Style: in a warm and gentle watercolor illustration with charming ink line-work. The style is soft, airy, and painterly, evoking the feeling of a sunlit afternoon on the Stanford campus. The color palette is light and cheerful, dominated by soft greens, warm sandstone yellows, and a gentle sky blue, all bleeding softly into one another to create a dreamy, heartfelt atmosphere. The central focus is a beautifully rendered, leafy tree, its branches reaching out gracefully, painted with visible, delicate brushstrokes that feel personal and handmade. Nestled near the tree's base is a sweet, hand-drawn cartoon green dinosaur, rendered with a friendly and endearing quality, holding a small greeting card with a simple, lovingly painted heart. This blend of sophisticated, natural scenery with a touch of innocent charm makes the card feel both professionally respectful and deeply personal, creating a memorable and emotionally resonant keepsake.

2. Left Interior (Story Development): UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY! You have complete creative freedom to design whatever you want for this left interior page! This is your artistic playground - create something genuinely innovative and unexpected that feels right for a thank-you card with motivating and uplifting tone. You can include: scenes, landscapes, objects, patterns, quotes, text, illustrations, realistic art, abstract art, or anything else that inspires you - but NO PEOPLE or characters unless the user specifically mentioned wanting people in their card description. Position any text safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10%). Think of something no one has done before! Surprise us with bold, imaginative, and memorable artistic choices while maintaining visual harmony with the overall card style and tone. Style: in a warm and gentle watercolor illustration with charming ink line-work. The style is soft, airy, and painterly, evoking the feeling of a sunlit afternoon on the Stanford campus. The color palette is light and cheerful, dominated by soft greens, warm sandstone yellows, and a gentle sky blue, all bleeding softly into one another to create a dreamy, heartfelt atmosphere. The central focus is a beautifully rendered, leafy tree, its branches reaching out gracefully, painted with visible, delicate brushstrokes that feel personal and handmade. Nestled near the tree's base is a sweet, hand-drawn cartoon green dinosaur, rendered with a friendly and endearing quality, holding a small greeting card with a simple, lovingly painted heart. This blend of sophisticated, natural scenery with a touch of innocent charm makes the card feel both professionally respectful and deeply personal, creating a memorable and emotionally resonant keepsake.

3. Right Interior (Story Climax): BE CREATIVE WITH MESSAGE DESIGN! Include message text: "John,

Thank you for being a part of AI for Good this year. Your presence and insightful contributions truly helped to elevate the conversation and inspire new ways of thinking. We are so grateful for minds like yours that are actively shaping a brighter, more thoughtful future for everyone.

With sincere appreciation,
The Vibecarding.com Team" positioned safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image) integrated into beautiful, innovative decorative artwork. HANDWRITING STYLE: Write the message in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that feels elegant and personal. The handwriting should be legible, flowing, and have natural character - not overly perfect but graceful and warm. Use a nice pen-style appearance with natural ink flow and slight variations in line weight. Think of sophisticated calligraphy that's still approachable and easy to read. Make the handwriting feel genuine and heartfelt. Think beyond typical florals and patterns - create something unexpected and artistic that perfectly frames the handwritten message - NO PEOPLE or characters. This should feel like the emotional peak of the card experience, harmonizing with the left interior as a cohesive spread. Avoid clich√© designs and create something genuinely special! Use the elegant cursive handwriting style described above. Style: in a warm and gentle watercolor illustration with charming ink line-work. The style is soft, airy, and painterly, evoking the feeling of a sunlit afternoon on the Stanford campus. The color palette is light and cheerful, dominated by soft greens, warm sandstone yellows, and a gentle sky blue, all bleeding softly into one another to create a dreamy, heartfelt atmosphere. The central focus is a beautifully rendered, leafy tree, its branches reaching out gracefully, painted with visible, delicate brushstrokes that feel personal and handmade. Nestled near the tree's base is a sweet, hand-drawn cartoon green dinosaur, rendered with a friendly and endearing quality, holding a small greeting card with a simple, lovingly painted heart. This blend of sophisticated, natural scenery with a touch of innocent charm makes the card feel both professionally respectful and deeply personal, creating a memorable and emotionally resonant keepsake.

4. Back Cover (Story Resolution): BE SUBTLY CREATIVE! Create a simple yet innovative decorative design that brings peaceful closure to the visual story. Reference subtle elements from the front cover but keep it minimal and serene - NO PEOPLE, just beautiful, unexpected artistic elements that go beyond typical patterns or florals. IMPORTANT: Leave the bottom-right corner area (approximately 1 inch square) completely clear and undecorated - this space is reserved for a QR code. Focus decorative elements toward the center and left side of the design. Think of something quietly beautiful and memorable that complements the overall design while being genuinely unique. This should feel like a peaceful, artistic ending that surprises with its subtle creativity. Style: in a warm and gentle watercolor illustration with charming ink line-work. The style is soft, airy, and painterly, evoking the feeling of a sunlit afternoon on the Stanford campus. The color palette is light and cheerful, dominated by soft greens, warm sandstone yellows, and a gentle sky blue, all bleeding softly into one another to create a dreamy, heartfelt atmosphere. The central focus is a beautifully rendered, leafy tree, its branches reaching out gracefully, painted with visible, delicate brushstrokes that feel personal and handmade. Nestled near the tree's base is a sweet, hand-drawn cartoon green dinosaur, rendered with a friendly and endearing quality, holding a small greeting card with a simple, lovingly painted heart. This blend of sophisticated, natural scenery with a touch of innocent charm makes the card feel both professionally respectful and deeply personal, creating a memorable and emotionally resonant keepsake.

VISUAL CONTINUITY CHECKLIST:
- Same color palette across all sections
- Consistent lighting/time of day
- Same artistic techniques and brushwork
- Recurring visual motifs or symbols (but make them unique and memorable!)
- Progressive emotional journey from introduction to resolution
- Front cover: stylized cartoon/illustrated characters if people are needed for the theme
- Left interior: CREATIVE FREEDOM but NO PEOPLE unless user specifically requested people in their description
- Right interior: focus on message space with innovative decorative elements (NO PEOPLE)
- Back cover: simple yet creative decorative design without text or people
- Use simplified, friendly, charming character design if including people (front cover only)
- CREATIVITY PRIORITY: Always choose the more innovative, surprising, and memorable option over generic designs

Return JSON:
{
  "frontCover": "detailed prompt with story opening elements",
  "backCover": "detailed prompt with story conclusion elements",
  "leftInterior": "detailed prompt with story development elements",
  "rightInterior": "detailed prompt with story climax elements"
}

IMPORTANT: Create a completely unique and different interpretation for this specific card variant. Use different creative approaches, color schemes, compositions, and artistic elements while maintaining the same core theme and requirements.

generatedPrompts.frontCover: Front cover of a greeting card with a watercolor illustration. The style is soft, airy, and painterly, with a light and cheerful color palette dominated by soft greens, warm sandstone yellows, and a gentle sky blue. The scene depicts a sunny day on a campus, likely Stanford, with a large, leafy tree in the foreground and a building with arches in the background. A cute, plump cartoon green dinosaur with large, expressive eyes is standing on the right side, holding a cream-colored card. The card has a red heart at the top and clearly readable text below it: "For John Gilbert", "AI For Good Conference", "Stanford CA", and "June 2025". The text is positioned centrally on the card, with ample spacing from the edges of the card. The artwork exhibits delicate brushstrokes, giving it a personal and handmade feel. The overall mood is charming, warm, and inspirational. The composition places the tree as a central element, with the dinosaur and the building serving as supporting elements, creating a balanced and inviting visual.
generatedPrompts.backCover: Back cover design for a greeting card with a warm and gentle watercolor illustration and charming ink line-work. The style is soft, airy, and painterly, evoking a serene and peaceful atmosphere. The color palette consists of a light, off-white background with subtle washes of soft sky blue at the top, fading into white towards the bottom. In the upper left quadrant, a single, hand-drawn leaf is depicted, colored in soft yellow and green with visible, delicate ink lines defining its veins and serrated edges. In the lower left quadrant, three small, stylized green footprints are arranged in a gentle curve, suggesting a subtle continuation of a journey or path. The design is minimal and clean, leaving ample negative space to ensure a sense of calm and resolution. The bottom-right corner, approximately a 1-inch square, is completely clear and undecorated, reserved for a potential QR code. This design provides a quiet, artistic conclusion to the visual story, hinting at natural elements and subtle movement without any text or characters.
generatedPrompts.leftInterior: Left interior page of a thank-you greeting card with a creative and innovative design, featuring a stylized brain depicted as a flourishing tree. The tree's trunk and branches are rendered in warm, earthy browns and soft greens, with delicate ink line-work. The canopy of the tree subtly forms the lobes of a human brain, with the roots anchoring firmly below. Within the brain-like canopy, small, glowing orbs of light, in a soft yellow hue, are strategically placed, symbolizing moments of insight and inspiration. The entire illustration is done in a warm and gentle watercolor style, with soft, airy, and painterly brushstrokes. The color palette is light and cheerful, dominated by muted greens, warm sandstone yellows, and hints of a pale, ethereal background. The overall atmosphere is one of growth, thought, and potential. Below this central illustration, the quote "The mind, once stretched by a new idea, never returns to its original dimensions." is beautifully inscribed in an elegant, flowing cursive script in a slightly darker brown ink, with natural character and warmth. The text is positioned centrally, ensuring readability and leaving ample space around the edges. The style is refined yet accessible, evoking an inspirational and motivating tone.
generatedPrompts.rightInterior:
Right interior page of a greeting card designed for message space with a dominant, elegant handwritten message. The artwork features a stylized, artistic branch with muted green leaves and two glowing lightbulbs on the left side, creating a subtle, nature-inspired border. The background is a soft, creamy, textured watercolor wash in light beige and pale green hues. The message is written in a sophisticated, dark ink cursive script that fills the majority of the right side of the card, leaving ample white space around it for readability. The typography is flowing and graceful, with a natural, slightly imperfect feel that conveys warmth and sincerity. The overall style is painterly and delicate, evoking an inspirational and uplifting tone.

Image generation prompt:
"Right interior page of a greeting card, watercolor illustration with fine ink line-work. The style is soft, airy, and painterly, with a delicate and sophisticated aesthetic. A stylized, organic branch with muted sage green leaves and two softly glowing, warm yellow lightbulbs is positioned on the left side, extending upwards from the bottom and curving towards the center, creating an artistic vignette. The background is a subtle, textured watercolor wash in light cream and pale green, with soft, blended edges. The main focus is the message, written in elegant, flowing, dark ink cursive script, filling the right two-thirds of the page. The handwriting should appear natural, warm, and legible, with slight variations in line weight suggestive of a fine fountain pen. The message is: 'John, Thank you for being a part of AI for Good this year. Your presence and insightful contributions truly helped to elevate the conversation and inspire new ways of thinking. We are so grateful for minds like yours that are actively shaping a brighter, more thoughtful future for everyone. With sincere appreciation, The Vibecarding.com Team.' The entire composition should have a light color theme, maintaining a professional yet charming and inspirational tone. Ensure all text is clearly readable and positioned with sufficient margin from the edges."
